title:
Involutivity of distributions at points of superdense tangency with
  respect to normal currents
abstract:
Let ${\mathcal D}$ and $T$ be, respectively, a $C^1$ distribution of
$k$-planes and a normal $k$-current on ${\mathbf R}^n$. Then ${\mathcal D}$ has
to be involutive at almost every superdensity point of the tangency set of $T$
with respect to ${\mathcal D}$.
